Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Legal_Provision_Involved: Convention relating to the Status of Refugees
Outcome: Application allowed, remanded for new hearing
Legal_Framework: International refugee law, Canadian immigration and refugee protection framework
Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Evidence_Type: Testimony, documentation of anti-Semitic incidents (vandalism, physical attacks, employment discrimination)
Legal_Statute: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Convention relating to the Status of Refugees
Governing_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under Article 1A(2) of the Refugee Convention
Protection_Claim: Need for international protection due to state inability to protect
State_Protection_Assessment: Insufficient despite government stance against anti-Semitism
Risk_Factor: History of anti-Semitic attacks, vulnerability as Jewish individuals
Credibility: Credible allegations supported by evidence of incidents
State_Protection_Adequacy: Found inadequate by court despite official policies
Risk_Nature: Ongoing personal and societal risk due to religious identity
Legal_Basis: Fear of persecution based on religion and membership in a particular social group
